Definition of Topology and Basic Examples

ğŸ“– Tá»•ng quan

ChÃ o má»«ng báº¡n Ä‘áº¿n vá»›i bÃ i giáº£ng quan trá»ng nháº¥t trong toÃ n bá»™ khÃ³a há»c! ÄÃ¢y lÃ  lÃºc chÃºng ta cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a chÃ­nh thá»©c: Topology lÃ  gÃ¬?

Sau khi Ä‘Ã£ chuáº©n bá»‹ qua lÃ½ thuyáº¿t táº­p há»£p, metric spaces, vÃ  Euclidean space, giá» Ä‘Ã¢y chÃºng ta sáºµn sÃ ng Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n má»™t bÆ°á»›c trá»«u tÆ°á»£ng hÃ³a máº¡nh máº½. ChÃºng ta sáº½ bá» qua táº¥t cáº£ â€œkhoáº£ng cÃ¡châ€ (distance) vÃ  chá»‰ giá»¯ láº¡i cáº¥u trÃºc (structure) vá» â€œgáº§nâ€ vÃ  â€œxaâ€.

Ã tÆ°á»Ÿng cá»‘t lÃµi:
Trong metric space, chÃºng ta Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a â€œopen setâ€ thÃ´ng qua open balls. NhÆ°ng náº¿u bá» metric Ä‘i vÃ  chá»‰ giá»¯ láº¡i táº­p há»£p cÃ¡c open sets, thÃ¬ ta váº«n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i vá» continuity, convergence, vÃ  nhiá»u khÃ¡i niá»‡m khÃ¡c!

ÄÃ¢y chÃ­nh lÃ  topology: Má»™t cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ nÃ³i vá» â€œcáº¥u trÃºcâ€ cá»§a khÃ´ng gian mÃ  khÃ´ng cáº§n metric.

Trong bÃ i nÃ y we lay absolute foundation. First, precise topological space definition emergesâ€”deceptively simple yet profoundly powerful. Understanding ba topology axioms reveals why theyâ€™re not arbitrary rules but natural requirements ensuring consistency. Exploring basic examples (trivial, discrete, cofinite topologies) shows extreme cases vÃ  builds intuition. Learning to compare topologies (coarser vs finer) introduces partial ordering on topology space itself. Finally, closed sets, interior, closure get defined purely via open sets, demonstrating how much geometry lives in abstract structure.

Táº¡i sao absolutely foundational? ÄÃ¢y lÃ  bedrock cá»§a entire topology edifice! Every concept followingâ€”continuous functions, compactness, connectedness, separation axiomsâ€”builds exclusively on this definition. Nothing else! Topology liberates us to study â€œshapeâ€ vÃ  â€œstructureâ€ independent of â€œsizeâ€ or â€œdistanceâ€, enabling geometric reasoning trong spaces where distance makes no sense (function spaces, quotient spaces, infinite-dimensional spaces). This abstraction proved revolutionary, unifying previously disparate branches of mathematics.

CÃ¢u chuyá»‡n vá» Abstraction

HÃ£y nhá»› láº¡i: Trong â„ vá»›i Euclidean metric, open set lÃ  táº­p U sao cho má»i Ä‘iá»ƒm x âˆˆ U cÃ³ má»™t â€œvÃ¹ng xung quanhâ€ cÃ²n náº±m trong U.

TÃ­nh cháº¥t cá»§a open sets trong â„:

    VÃ­ dá»¥: (0,2) âˆ© (1,3) = (1,2) open

1. Topological Space (KhÃ´ng gian TÃ´-pÃ´)

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Topology):
Cho X lÃ  má»™t táº­p há»£p. Má»™t topology trÃªn X lÃ  má»™t há» ğœ cÃ¡c táº­p con cá»§a X (gá»i lÃ  open sets) thá»a mÃ£n ba Ä‘iá»u kiá»‡n:

(T1) Empty set vÃ  whole space: \(\emptyset \in \tau \quad \text{vÃ } \quad X \in \tau\)

(T2) Arbitrary unions: \(\{U_\alpha\}_{\alpha \in I} \subseteq \tau \implies \bigcup_{\alpha \in I} U_\alpha \in \tau\)

(Há»£p cá»§a báº¥t ká»³ há» nÃ o cÃ¡c open sets lÃ  open)

(T3) Finite intersections: \(U_1, U_2, \ldots, U_n \in \tau \implies U_1 \cap U_2 \cap \cdots \cap U_n \in \tau\)

(Giao cá»§a há»¯u háº¡n open sets lÃ  open)

KÃ½ hiá»‡u: Cáº·p (X, ğœ) Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  topological space (khÃ´ng gian tÃ´-pÃ´).

Trá»±c giÃ¡c:

  • (T1): â€œKhÃ´ng cÃ³ gÃ¬â€ vÃ  â€œtoÃ n bá»™â€ Ä‘á»u â€œopenâ€
  • (T2): GhÃ©p nhiá»u vÃ¹ng open láº¡i váº«n open
  • (T3): Giao má»™t sá»‘ há»¯u háº¡n vÃ¹ng open váº«n open

ChÃº Ã½ quan trá»ng:

  • Unions cÃ³ thá»ƒ tÃ¹y Ã½ (vÃ´ háº¡n, uncountable!)
  • Intersections chá»‰ há»¯u háº¡n!

Táº¡i sao khÃ´ng cho phÃ©p giao vÃ´ háº¡n?
XÃ©t trong â„: â‹‚â‚™â‚Œâ‚^âˆ (-1/n, 1/n) = {0}, nhÆ°ng {0} khÃ´ng open trong â„!

2. Basic Examples (VÃ­ dá»¥ CÆ¡ báº£n)

  • (T2): âˆ… âˆª X = X âˆˆ ğœ âœ“

Example 4: Cofinite Topology

3. Comparing Topologies (So sÃ¡nh Topology)

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Coarser/Finer):
Cho ğœâ‚, ğœâ‚‚ lÃ  hai topologies trÃªn X.

  • ğœâ‚ coarser (thÃ´ hÆ¡n) than ğœâ‚‚ náº¿u ğœâ‚ âŠ† ğœâ‚‚
  • ğœâ‚‚ finer (má»‹n hÆ¡n) than ğœâ‚ náº¿u ğœâ‚‚ âŠ‡ ğœâ‚

Trá»±c giÃ¡c:

  • Finer: Nhiá»u open sets hÆ¡n â†’ â€œphÃ¢n biá»‡tâ€ nhiá»u hÆ¡n

VÃ­ dá»¥ trÃªn X = {a, b, c}:

  1. ğœâ‚ = {âˆ…, X} (trivial)
  2. ğœâ‚‚ = {âˆ…, {a}, X}
  3. ğœâ‚ƒ = {âˆ…, {a}, {b}, {a,b}, X}
  4. ğœâ‚„ = ğ’«(X) (discrete)

Thá»© tá»±: ğœâ‚ âŠ† ğœâ‚‚ âŠ† ğœâ‚ƒ âŠ† ğœâ‚„

Má»‘i quan há»‡:

  • Trivial lÃ  coarsest possible
  • Discrete lÃ  finest possible
  • Giá»¯a chÃºng cÃ³ vÃ´ sá»‘ topologies khÃ¡c!

Comparison trÃªn â„: \(\tau_{\text{trivial}} \subseteq \tau_{\text{cofinite}} \subseteq \tau_{\text{cocountable}} \subseteq \tau_{\text{Euclidean}} \subseteq \tau_{\text{discrete}}\)

4. Closed Sets (Táº­p ÄÃ³ng)

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a:
Trong topological space (X, ğœ), táº­p F âŠ† X lÃ  closed náº¿u: \(X \setminus F \in \tau\)

NÃ³i cÃ¡ch khÃ¡c: F closed âŸº bÃ¹ cá»§a F open.

VÃ­ dá»¥ trong â„ (Euclidean topology):

  • [a, b] closed (vÃ¬ â„ \ [a,b] = (-âˆ,a) âˆª (b,âˆ) open)
  • {x} closed (singleton)
  • â„• closed
  • â„š KHÃ”NG closed (vÃ¬ â„ \ â„š khÃ´ng open)

TÃ­nh cháº¥t cá»§a closed sets:

Dual Axioms:

  1. âˆ… vÃ  X closed
  2. Giao tÃ¹y Ã½ cÃ¡c closed sets lÃ  closed
  3. Há»£p há»¯u háº¡n cÃ¡c closed sets lÃ  closed

Chá»©ng minh (sketch): DÃ¹ng De Morganâ€™s laws vÃ  axioms cá»§a open sets.

ChÃº Ã½:

  • Má»™t táº­p cÃ³ thá»ƒ khÃ´ng open khÃ´ng closed! (VÃ­ dá»¥: [0,1) trong â„)


PhÃ¢n biá»‡t open vÃ  closed sets - Nguá»“n concept

5. Interior, Closure, Boundary

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Interior - Pháº§n trong):
Interior cá»§a A âŠ† X lÃ  há»£p cá»§a táº¥t cáº£ open sets chá»©a trong A: \(\text{int}(A) = AÂ° = \bigcup \{U \in \tau : U \subseteq A\}\)

Trá»±c giÃ¡c: Pháº§n â€œhoÃ n toÃ n bÃªn trongâ€ Aâ€”cÃ¡c Ä‘iá»ƒm cÃ³ â€œkhÃ´ng gian xung quanhâ€ trong A.

VÃ­ dá»¥ trong â„:

  • int([0,1]) = (0,1)
  • int(â„š) = âˆ… (khÃ´ng cÃ³ open interval nÃ o trong â„š)
  • int((0,1)) = (0,1)

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Closure - Bao Ä‘Ã³ng):
Closure cá»§a A âŠ† X lÃ  giao cá»§a táº¥t cáº£ closed sets chá»©a A: \(\overline{A} = \text{cl}(A) = \bigcap \{F : F \text{ closed}, A \subseteq F\}\)

Trá»±c giÃ¡c: Táº­p nhá» nháº¥t chá»©a A vÃ  â€œranh giá»›iâ€ cá»§a A.

VÃ­ dá»¥ trong â„:

  • cl((0,1)) = [0,1]
  • cl(â„š) = â„ (â„š â€œdenseâ€ trong â„)
  • cl({1/n : n âˆˆ â„•}) = {1/n : n âˆˆ â„•} âˆª {0}

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Boundary - BiÃªn):
Boundary cá»§a A lÃ : \(\partial A = \overline{A} \setminus AÂ°\)

VÃ­ dá»¥ trong â„:

  • âˆ‚((0,1)) = {0, 1}
  • âˆ‚([0,1]) = {0, 1}
  • âˆ‚(â„š) = â„ (má»i sá»‘ thá»±c lÃ  boundary point cá»§a â„š!)

TÃ­nh cháº¥t quan trá»ng:

  1. int(A) âŠ† A âŠ† cl(A)
  2. A open âŸº A = int(A)
  3. A closed âŸº A = cl(A)
  4. cl(A) = A âˆª âˆ‚A

ğŸ§© Exercises

Basic Understanding

  1. Verify Topology:
    Cho X = {a, b, c}. CÃ¡c há» sau cÃ³ pháº£i lÃ  topology khÃ´ng? Táº¡i sao?
    • a) ğœ = {âˆ…, {a}, {a,b}, X}
    • b) ğœ = {âˆ…, {a}, {b}, {a,b}, X}
    • c) ğœ = {âˆ…, {a}, {b}, {c}, X}

  2. List Open Sets:
    X = {1, 2, 3, 4}, ğœ = cofinite topology.
    Liá»‡t kÃª táº¥t cáº£ open sets vÃ  closed sets.

  3. Topology on â„•:
    TrÃªn â„• vá»›i cofinite topology, cÃ¡c táº­p sau open hay closed?
    • a) {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}
    • b) {n âˆˆ â„• : n > 100}
    • c) {2, 4, 6, 8, â€¦} (sá»‘ cháºµn)

Interior, Closure, Boundary

  1. Compute Interior:
    Trong â„ vá»›i Euclidean topology, tÃ¬m int(A):
    • a) A = [0, 1] âˆª {2}
    • b) A = â„š âˆ© [0, 1]
    • c) A = {1/n : n âˆˆ â„•}
  2. Compute Closure:
    Trong â„, tÃ¬m cl(A):
    • a) A = (0, 1) âˆª (2, 3)
    • b) A = {1/n : n âˆˆ â„•}
    • c) A = â„¤
  3. Boundary Examples:
    TÃ¬m âˆ‚A trong â„:
    • a) A = (0, 1]
    • b) A = â„š
    • c) A = Cantor set

Comparing Topologies

  1. Order Topologies:
    TrÃªn X = {a, b, c, d}, cho:
    • ğœâ‚ = {âˆ…, X}
    • ğœâ‚‚ = {âˆ…, {a}, X}
    • ğœâ‚ƒ = {âˆ…, {a}, {b,c}, {a,b,c}, X}

    Sáº¯p xáº¿p theo thá»© tá»± coarser â†’ finer.

  2. Euclidean vs Discrete:
    Chá»©ng minh ráº±ng Euclidean topology trÃªn â„ coarser than discrete topology.
    CÃ³ tá»“n táº¡i topology giá»¯a chÃºng khÃ´ng?

Advanced

  1. Construct Topology:
    TrÃªn â„, Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a: U open âŸº U lÃ  há»£p cá»§a cÃ¡c khoáº£ng [a, b).
    Chá»©ng minh Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  topology. NÃ³ cÃ³ báº±ng Euclidean topology khÃ´ng?

  2. Indiscrete Continuity:

  1. Why Three Axioms?:
    Giáº£i thÃ­ch táº¡i sao ba axioms (T1), (T2), (T3) lÃ  â€œtá»± nhiÃªnâ€ náº¿u muá»‘n generalize khÃ¡i niá»‡m â€œopenâ€ tá»« metric spaces.

  2. Finite vs Infinite:
    Táº¡i sao (T2) cho phÃ©p unions vÃ´ háº¡n nhÆ°ng (T3) chá»‰ intersections há»¯u háº¡n?
    Cho vÃ­ dá»¥ minh há»a Ä‘iá»u gÃ¬ xáº£y ra náº¿u cho phÃ©p intersections vÃ´ háº¡n.

  3. Open vs Closed:

ğŸ“ Summary

âœ… Three Axioms:
